description.narrative: By end of 2019, schools and health facilities in Mali have adequate and sustainable water and sanitation infrastructures, and improved hygiene conditions, especially in rural areas and areas affected by humanitarian situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end of 2019, schools and health facilities in Mali have adequate and sustainable water and sanitation infrastructures, and improved hygiene conditions, especially in rural areas and areas affected by humanitarian situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF programme led to an improved enabling environment for water, sanitation and hygiene development in schools and health centers in Mali by accelerating efforts to institutionalize WASH interventions in the health and education sector, developing and refining evidence-based intervention models and reducing bottlenecks affecting the scaling up of services provided for the most deprived children and women. With UNICEF direct support in 2019, 95 schools reaching 15,145 children (7,024 girls, 8,121 boys) and 61 health centers gained access to improved water and gender-friendly sanitation facilities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/02/2020

title.narrative: Health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) equipped with WASH facilities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of schools supported by UNICEF during the year of reporting with separate sanitation facilities for boys and girls
Number of schools with access to basic WASH service in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
